I did my Ph.D. advised by Pierre Hansen on exact methods for the minimum sum-of-squares problem (aka k-means clustering). I have also been a professor at the Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte, Brazil, since 2009. My research interests include data mining, machine learning, optimization, mathematical programming and how these disciplines interact to tackle problems in our Big Data era. I have published in leading operations research and data mining journals including Machine Learning, Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery, European Journal of Operational Research, Mathematical Programming and Journal of Global Optimization. By combining processes for analyzing highly targeted data and real-time decision-making, their mathematical model-based tools will help organizations improve performance, by creating highly customized outputs and taking into account the environments, needs and individual behaviors of their clients or users.
